intro: Lisianthius habuensis, commonly known as the Okinawan lisianthium, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive tubular shape that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
